FuncDef: The switch virtual-system command switches from the existing managed virtual system (VS) to a target VS.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of a target VS.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-insensitive characters. The string can be a combination of letters, numerals, underlines (_), or subtraction signs (-). The name must begin with an English letter, except "all", "brief", or "verbose".

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
When configuring features or performing other operations on different VSs, a physical(PS) administrator can run the vs-name command to switch from one VS to another one.
Prerequisites
A target VS has been successfully created.
Configuration Impact
After the switch virtual-system command is run, a PS administrator can perform operations on VSs without having to switch windows.
Follow-up Procedure
After you run the switch virtual-system vs-name command and switch to a target VS, you can use quit command to quit the VS.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
Only a PS administrator can switch between VSs.
Accessing a non-Admin-VS from another non-Admin-VS is not allowed.
